activities: Janssen Research & Development (JRD) receives personal information about research subjects, patients, investigators and staff, service providers and business partners, health care professionals, suppliers, and industry experts all in support of JRD’s clinical research operations. As a global company, JRD also processes EU employee personal information through JRD accesses the global corporate HR system, and other HR systems, that contain employee data from the EU and Switzerland and is housed in the United States. The global corporate system is used by all operating companies within the corporation.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Data processed in support of clinical operations and human resources data.
recoursemech: EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) Panel and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
